Description: Four cornelian ring beads one of which is much smaller than the others, and two toggle beads of the same material, together with a single toggle bead of ivory.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Faras (Nubia), Protodynastic cemetery Cemetery 3 Grave 31
Curator's comments: Also form this burial: anklets (1912,1109.27 & 1912,1109.30), beads (1912,1109.31 & 1912,1109.33), necklace (1912,1109.29), shell (1912,1109.28). Although registered with objects from grave 31, these beads are not recorded among the contents of that grave (F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 14-15). Possibly they are the 'cruciform' beads from grave 59 (ibid., 10). For parallels to the toggle beads, see ; G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), pl.XVII, 73, M2. Similar beads were found in the tomb of Djer at Abydos, but these were not pierced, but they had a ridge round the middle for the thread. See A. Wilkinson, 'Ancient Egyptian Jewellery' (London, 1971), 17-18 and fig. 11.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (156)
